com.goebl.david

Class Webb

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.goebl.david.Webb

  • public class Webb
extends Object
    Lightweight Java HTTP-Client for calling JSON REST-Services (especially for Android).
    Author:
    hgoebl

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static Webb create()
        Create an instance which can be reused for multiple requests in the same Thread.
        Returns:
        the created instance.

      • setGlobalHeader

        public static void setGlobalHeader(String name,
                                   Object value)
        Set the value for a named header which is valid for all requests in the running JVM.
        The value can be overwritten by calling setDefaultHeader(String, Object) and/or Request.header(String, Object).
        For the supported types for values see Request.header(String, Object).
        Parameters:
        name - name of the header (regarding HTTP it is not case-sensitive, but here case is important).
        value - value of the header. If null the header value is cleared (effectively not set).
        See Also:
        setDefaultHeader(String, Object), Request.header(String, Object)

      • setGlobalBaseUri

        public static void setGlobalBaseUri(String globalBaseUri)
        Set the base URI for all requests starting in this JVM from now.
        For all requests this value is taken as a kind of prefix for the effective URI, so you can address the URIs relatively. The value is only taken when setBaseUri(String) is not called or called with null.
        Parameters:
        globalBaseUri - the prefix for all URIs of new Requests.
        See Also:
        setBaseUri(String)

      • setJsonIndentFactor

        public static void setJsonIndentFactor(int indentFactor)
        The number of characters to indent child properties, -1 for "productive" code.
        Default is production ready JSON (-1) means no indentation (single-line serialization).
        Parameters:
        indentFactor - the number of spaces to indent

      • setConnectTimeout

        public static void setConnectTimeout(int globalConnectTimeout)
        Set the timeout in milliseconds for connecting the server.
        In contrast to HttpURLConnection, we use a default timeout of 10 seconds, since no timeout is odd.
        Can be overwritten for each Request with Request.connectTimeout(int).
        Parameters:
        globalConnectTimeout - the new timeout or <= 0 to use HttpURLConnection default timeout.

      • setReadTimeout

        public static void setReadTimeout(int globalReadTimeout)
        Set the timeout in milliseconds for getting response from the server.
        In contrast to HttpURLConnection, we use a default timeout of 3 minutes, since no timeout is odd.
        Can be overwritten for each Request with Request.readTimeout(int).
        Parameters:
        globalReadTimeout - the new timeout or <= 0 to use HttpURLConnection default timeout.

      • setFollowRedirects

        public void setFollowRedirects(boolean auto)
        See .
        Use this method to set the behaviour for all requests created by this instance when receiving redirect responses. You can overwrite the setting for a single request by calling Request.followRedirects(boolean).
        Parameters:
        auto - true to automatically follow redirects (HTTP status code 3xx). Default value comes from HttpURLConnection and should be true.

      • setSSLSocketFactory

        public void setSSLSocketFactory(SSLSocketFactory sslSocketFactory)
        Set a custom SSLSocketFactory, most likely to relax Certification checking.
        Parameters:
        sslSocketFactory - the factory to use (see test cases for an example).

      • setHostnameVerifier

        public void setHostnameVerifier(HostnameVerifier hostnameVerifier)
        Set a custom HostnameVerifier, most likely to relax host-name checking.
        Parameters:
        hostnameVerifier - the verifier (see test cases for an example).

      • setBaseUri

        public void setBaseUri(String baseUri)
        Set the base URI for all requests created from this instance.
        For all requests this value is taken as a kind of prefix for the effective URI, so you can address the URIs relatively. The value takes precedence over the value set in setGlobalBaseUri(String).
        Parameters:
        baseUri - the prefix for all URIs of new Requests.
        See Also:
        setGlobalBaseUri(String)

      • getBaseUri

        public String getBaseUri()
        Returns the base URI of this instance.
        Returns:
        base URI

      • setDefaultHeader

        public void setDefaultHeader(String name,
                             Object value)
        Set the value for a named header which is valid for all requests created by this instance.
        The value takes precedence over setGlobalHeader(String, Object) but can be overwritten by Request.header(String, Object).
        For the supported types for values see Request.header(String, Object).
        Parameters:
        name - name of the header (regarding HTTP it is not case-sensitive, but here case is important).
        value - value of the header. If null the header value is cleared (effectively not set). When setting the value to null, a value from global headers can shine through.
        See Also:
        setGlobalHeader(String, Object), Request.header(String, Object)

      • setRetryManager

        public void setRetryManager(RetryManager retryManager)
        Registers an alternative RetryManager.
        Parameters:
        retryManager - the new manager for deciding whether it makes sense to retry a request.

      • get

        public Request get(String pathOrUri)
        Creates a GET HTTP request with the specified absolute or relative URI.
        Parameters:
        pathOrUri - the URI (will be concatenated with global URI or default URI without further checking). If it starts already with http:// or https:// this URI is taken and all base URIs are ignored.
        Returns:
        the created Request object (in fact it's more a builder than a real request object)

      • post

        public Request post(String pathOrUri)
        Creates a POST HTTP request with the specified absolute or relative URI.
        Parameters:
        pathOrUri - the URI (will be concatenated with global URI or default URI without further checking) If it starts already with http:// or https:// this URI is taken and all base URIs are ignored.
        Returns:
        the created Request object (in fact it's more a builder than a real request object)

      • put

        public Request put(String pathOrUri)
        Creates a PUT HTTP request with the specified absolute or relative URI.
        Parameters:
        pathOrUri - the URI (will be concatenated with global URI or default URI without further checking) If it starts already with http:// or https:// this URI is taken and all base URIs are ignored.
        Returns:
        the created Request object (in fact it's more a builder than a real request object)

      • delete

        public Request delete(String pathOrUri)
        Creates a DELETE HTTP request with the specified absolute or relative URI.
        Parameters:
        pathOrUri - the URI (will be concatenated with global URI or default URI without further checking) If it starts already with http:// or https:// this URI is taken and all base URIs are ignored.
        Returns:
        the created Request object (in fact it's more a builder than a real request object)
